PARAGRAPH.STRING: , at 4680 Meters above sea level, is the ninth highest mountain of Venezuela, and the third highest of the Sierra de la Culata range in the Mérida State,
name which translates as "Bread of Sugar" is due to the sandy slopes of
, which resembles "Pan dulce", a kind of bread sprinkled with sugar eaten in the country. From
summit a great escenic view can be seen, including Lake Maracaibo, Sierra Nevada de Mérida and surrounding mountains of the Sierra de la Culata.
